item.title: Britain's Evans tests positive for cocaine
item.description: British number three Dan Evans announces he tested positive for cocaine in a drugs test taken in April, saying: "I made a mistake."

item.title: Mauricio Pellegrino: Southampton appoint former Alaves boss as manager
item.description: Southampton appoint Mauricio Pellegrino as their new manager, with the 45-year-old former Alaves boss replacing Claude Puel.

item.title: Watch: Roy controversially given out obstructing the field
item.description: England batsman Jason Roy is controversially given out for obstructing the field against South Africa during the second Twenty20 at Taunton.

item.title: Verstappen fastest before crashing in Azerbaijan practice
item.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen is fastest before crashing during practice for the Azerbaijan Grand Prix, with Lewis Hamilton only 10th.

item.title: 'A Lions team of warriors that can beat the All Blacks' - Guscott column
item.description: The British and Irish Lions, armed with a clinical attacking edge, are good enough to beat the All Blacks, says Lions great Jeremy Guscott.

item.title: South Africa level series with dramatic victory
item.description: England's series with South Africa goes to a decider as the Proteas level the three-game contest with a dramatic three-run victory.

item.title: England's Winfield ruled out of Women's World Cup opener
item.description: England opening batter and wicketkeeper Lauren Winfield will miss at least their World Cup opener because of injury.

item.title: Queen's 2017: Grigor Dimitrov and Marin Cilic through to Aegon Championships semi-finals
item.description: Former Queen's champions Grigor Dimitrov and Marin Cilic reach this year's Aegon Championships semi-finals.

item.title: Henry Blofeld: Seagulls, trousers & porpoises - Blofeld's best pint-sized moments
item.description: Henry Blofeld retires from BBC Radio's Test Match Special in September, so BBC Sport have collected together some of his best pint-sized moments.

item.title: Winter and Caravaggio give O'Brien Ascot double
item.description: Winter and Caravaggio give trainer Aidan O'Brien and jockey Ryan Moore a big-race double at Royal Ascot.

item.title: European Boxing Championships 2017: Seven English boxers to contest finals
item.description: England will have seven fighters in Saturday's finals at the European Boxing Championships in Ukraine.

item.title: Royal Ascot jockey has pint of beer thrown at him
item.description: Jockey Andrea Atzeni says a Royal Ascot racegoer threw a pint of beer at him as he made his way to the start of the last race on Friday.

item.title: Ten Wales players ill before win over Samoa - reaction & highlights
item.description: Wales coach Robin McBryde says his players overcame a sickness bug in beating Samoa 19-17 in Apia.

item.title: Itoje in, Jones out - who made your Lions XV?
item.description: Leigh Halfpenny or Liam Williams? Alun Wyn Jones or Maro Itoje? Owen Farrell or Johnny Sexton? BBC Sport users have had their say.

item.title: Garcia & Stenson one shot off lead in BMW International
item.description: Defending champion Henrik Stenson and Masters winner Sergio Garcia trail the BMW International leaders by one in Munich.

item.title: Murray to play two matches at Hurlingham before Wimbledon
item.description: Andy Murray adds two exhibition matches to his Wimbledon preparations after his early exit from the Aegon Championships.

item.title: Ireland to hold talks about playing England in Lord's Test
item.description: Ireland are optimistic talks will lead to them facing England in a Test at Lord's after they were granted Test status.

item.title: Personalise your BBC Sport app and sign up for notifications
item.description: With latest scores and headlines sent straight to your device, personalisation and much more, ensure you have a great sporting life with BBC Sport.

item.title: Dan Evans: Pundits on British number three's failed drugs test
item.description: BBC's tennis team of Sue Barker, Peter Fleming and John Lloyd discuss British number three Dan Evans' failed drugs test.

item.title: England v South Africa: Debutant Tom Curran removes Reeza Hendricks with second ball
item.description: England debutant Tom Curran bowls South Africa's Reeza Hendricks with his second delivery in the second Twenty20 match at Taunton.

item.title: Queen's 2017: Marin Cilic beats Donald Young in quarter-final
item.description: Marin Cilic moves into the semi-finals at Queen's by beating Donald Young 6-4 7-5.

item.title: Henry Blofeld's iconic commentary from England's 1981 Ashes win
item.description: Listen to Henry Blofeld's iconic commentary from England's 1981 third Ashes Test win.

item.title: Highlights: Samoa 17-19 Wales
item.description: Watch BBC Scrum V's highlights as Wales end their summer tour with a 19-17 win in Samoa.

item.title: Women's World Cup 2017: Who's playing and who to look out for
item.description: With the 11th staging of the Women's World Cup upon us, BBC Sport looks at which countries are taking part and who could be the stand-out players.

item.title: Super League: Widnes' Corey Thompson scores to send Leigh Centurions bottom
item.description: Widnes Vikings' wing Corey Thompson scores a "great" try in the 36-10 victory over Leigh that sends the Centurions bottom of Super League.

item.title: Henry Blofeld: "Difficult and sad" decision to leave Test Match Special
item.description: Henry Blofeld says it was a "very difficult" decision to retire from BBC Radio's Test Match Special after 45 years.

item.title: British and Irish Lions 2017: All Blacks supporters welcome Lions fans into their homes
item.description: With many Lions fans struggling for accommodation, some people in Auckland have opened up their homes before the first Test.

item.title: Women's Sport Week 2017: Heather Knight relishes Women's World Cup after moon boot adventures
item.description: Women's Sport Week continues as Heather Knight puts away her crutches in time to lead England into the Women's World Cup.

item.title: Floyd Mayweather v Conor McGregor: Can Crumlin ABC spirit claim Las Vegas bout?
item.description: Conor McGregor's career began at Crumlin ABC but BBC Radio 5 live asks if a puncher's chance is enough to shock the world?

item.title: 10 sports stars who became actors
item.description: Eric Cantona, Lewis Hamilton and eight more sports figures who have tried their hand at film roles.

item.title: The favourites, the players, the records - your Women's World Cup guide
item.description: Who are definitely going to cause an upset? Which England player is "fired up"? BBC Sport previews the Women's World Cup.

item.title: Wimbledon: Pick your greatest moments from Arthur Ashe to Andy Murray
item.description: The BBC is celebrating 90 years at Wimbledon by giving you the chance to pick your top three moments from the All England Club.

item.title: Would 60-minute games work? Banning penalty rebounds? BBC pundit has his say
item.description: BBC football analyst Pat Nevin looks at the proposals to change the laws of the game and gives his verdict on the more radical ideas.

item.title: Sport on the BBC: Best of this week's TV & radio coverage
item.description: This week's sport on the BBC includes tennis from Queen's Club, horse racing at Royal Ascot and the Azerbaijan Grand Prix.
